method.doc: To configure an instance with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP POST command on the Reverse Proxy resource URI.

param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: inst_name
param.doc: This is the new instance name, which is a unique name that identifies the instance. Multiple instances can be installed on that same computer system. Each instance must have a unique name.

param.name: host
param.doc: The host name that is used by the Security Verify Access policy server to contact the appliance. Valid values include any valid host name or IP address. For example: libra.dallas.ibm.com.

param.name: domain
param.doc: The Security Verify Access domain.

param.name: admin_id
param.doc: The Security Verify Access administrator name.

param.name: admin_pwd
param.doc: The Security Verify Access administrator password.

param.name: ssl_yn
param.doc: Specifies whether to enable SSL communication between the instance and the LDAP server. The value can be set to "yes" or "no".

param.name: key_file
param.doc: The file that contains the LDAP SSL certificate. This parameter is only valid if ssl_yn is set to "yes".

param.name: cert_label
param.doc: The LDAP client certificate label. This parameter is only valid if ssl_yn is set to "yes".

param.name: ssl_port
param.doc: The port number through which to communicate with the LDAP server. This parameter is only valid if ssl_yn is set to "yes".

param.name: http_yn
param.doc: Specifies whether to accept user requests across the HTTP protocol. The value can be set to "yes" or "no".

param.name: https_yn
param.doc: Specifies whether to accept user requests across the HTTPS protocol. The value can be set to "yes" or "no".

param.name: description
param.doc: A description of the new reverse proxy instance.
